Ken Martin.title: Celestial Inventions

Ken Martin.title: Crystal Light (77-79 Sessions) Volume 1
Ken Martin.about:
Back in April 2022 I found a box of 10" AND 7" Reels of tape in my garage which I remember packing back in 2002 before my relocation to Spain.

On checking the reels I found some recording sessions dating back to 1977-79. 

Some recordings and tapes were damaged beyond salvage, I have so far managed to process the tracks on this Album using digital software .

This recording period for me was my Experimental Ambient phase which I still love.



If you like Organ and Space Drone music then this will be for you.

I hope more findings will be good enough to create a Volume 2.

I hope you enjoy.

Ken Martin.title: Echoes
Ken Martin.about:
Recorded at Studio Moixeta, Spain March - April 2022



It's ironic I chose to do some of these pieces back in March, when I had Klaus Schulze early days in mind for the Organ drone tracks.

This was how I started after discovering K.S back in 1971.

I was shocked of the news that Klaus had past away so sudden.

I would like to dedicate this Album to Klaus Schulze the Master.

He was a influence to me and many to produce Electronic Space Music which I will continue to do until my great day.

Ken Martin.title: Meditational Sequences VOL 2
Ken Martin.about:
Recorded at Studio Moixeta, Spain December 2021-March 2022

The original Meditational Sequences was recorded back in 1990

With a thirty two year gap I decided to record Volume 2 using a different approach incorporating plenty of sequences and samples unlike VOL1 which was more of Drones and Experimental textures.

Ken Martin.title: Moments in Sound
Ken Martin.about:
Recorded at Studio Moixeta, Spain November 2021

Improvisations and studies on Karl Heinz Stockhausen "HYMNEN" "GESANG DER JUNGLINGE" and "MITTWOCHS GRUS"

Stockhausen has been a very big influence on my compositions since the early seventies, and for followers of my music who may be familiar with Stockhausen may have listened to these influential sounds in some of my compositions.

The style of music is still Electronically based but with added Human voices, some my own and some samples containing percussion.

I hope you enjoy this Album as much has I enjoyed creating these "Moments in Sound"

Ken Martin.title: The Eternal Warrior
Ken Martin.about:
This is a tribute Album to Isao Tomita which I have been working on over the last 4 years in between other projects.

The project was something I wanted to do when he was alive, but on his passing a while ago I was determined to complete this project.

This is my interpretation of the Genius Tomita who has inspired many people over the years with his innovations on Classical Electronic Music

We could never replace what Tomita achieved but I hope that my contribution to him is appreciated.

Ken Martin.title: The Inner Sanctum
Ken Martin.about:
Some Electronic Experimental Jamming Material from 1978-81 along with selected tracks from 1999-2002

The 1978 tracks were recovered from tape and have been processed to eliminate background noise and some dropouts which cannot be totally removed.

Originally using a Yamaha Due Organ, JEN SX1000, 1974 Arp Odyssey. recorded on a TEAC 3340 Four Track and mixed and mastered to an AKAI GX650 D which I still have to this day..

Ken Martin.title: Music For Film Volume 1
Ken Martin.about:
Something different from me, "Music for Film" has been in the pipeline for quite some time ever since I did a set for someone in Cambridge University back in 1990 which was more for TV than Film. I cannot remember the guy's name but I never heard anymore what became of my sets I sent to him.



I hope you enjoy these compositions.
